title: I've Done the Research, Everyone's Wearing These 5 Expensive-Looking Jewellery Trends Right Now
excerpt: 2024 jewellery trends have made us fall in love with accessorising again. Keep reading for the expensive-looking jewellery trends we can't stop thinking about.
text: If there's one thing I'm always looking out for when browsing my favourite sites, it's expensive-looking jewellery. Whilst jewellery has always been the ultimate finishing touch that can instantly transform a look, it's definitely playing a more important role in 2024 than ever. Whether it's a pair of sculptural earrings or a statement chain necklace, the right piece can make any outfit feel more elevated, polished, and expensive. However, not everyone can or wants to invest in high-end designer pieces that can cost thousands. While luxury brands like Cartier and Van Cleef & Arpels are renowned for their exquisite craftsmanship and timeless designs, the reality is that many of us are looking for ways to capture that same level of elegance without the hefty price tag. This is where the expensive-looking jewellery trend comes into play.While we all dream of owning a Cartier Panthère watch or a diamond-encrusted necklace, in recent years, we as shoppers have become increasingly conscious of their purchasing decisions, opting for jewellery that combines timeless style and affordability. The idea is to embrace pieces that deliver high-end aesthetics without compromising on quality or breaking the bank. And thankfully, whilst the allure of luxury jewellery is undeniable, it just so happens that there are countless affordable options on the market that offer the same level of sophistication. Instead of investing in pieces that may only be worn on special occasions, many are now seeking versatile jewellery that can be styled for everyday wear, delivering a luxe feel for a fraction of the cost.This season, the runways have showcased a myriad of expensive-looking jewellery trends that are both striking and accessible. From the bold chains seen at Bottega Veneta to the crystal-embellished pieces at Gucci, designers have embraced an aesthetic that's both refined and modern. But it's not just the runways influencing this shift—our favourite fashion influencers, like Marianne Smyth and Lois Sterling, are embracing jewellery that looks luxe but remains wallet-friendly. These tastemakers show us how to incorporate runway-worthy pieces into everyday looks, proving that you don't need to spend a fortune to achieve that high-end vibe.So, what makes an expensive-looking jewellery piece? It's all about thoughtful design, quality materials, and the way a piece catches the eye. Sleek, minimalist designs, polished finishes, and details like sculptural forms or pearls all contribute to a luxurious appearance. A well-crafted gold-plated necklace or a pair of oversized crystal earrings can look just as stunning as something from a designer jewellery brand if styled correctly. In fact, the lines between costume and fine jewellery have blurred, with designer fashion houses now offering chic pieces at more accessible prices.To help you navigate this season's expensive-looking jewellery trends, we've curated five must-try styles that give you the runway feel without the high-end price. From chunky chains to pearls with a twist, these pieces are perfect for anyone looking to elevate their jewellery game while staying budget-conscious.1. Chunky ChainsStyle Notes: It's official: statement chains are back, and bigger than ever. Think oversized links in both gold and silver, as seen on the runways of Bottega Veneta and Valentino. These bold necklaces and bracelets create a focal point to even the simplest outfit, giving you a high-fashion feel without needing anything else.The perfect blend of being refined but also cool and contemporary, these bolder pieces can make a subtle statement with even the most simple outfit. Pair a gold chain with a classic white tee and jeans for a relaxed daytime look, or layer it over a silk blouse for evening wear. To make the look more affordable, opt for gold-plated pieces that still give you the shine and weight of luxury jewellery.Shop the Trend: Astrid & Miyu Bold Link Chain Bracelet in Gold This gold-plated link chain bracelet adds instant sophistication to your everyday stack. The chunky links draw attention to your neckline, whether worn solo or layered with your favourite delicate pieces. Missoma Zenyu Link Chunky Chain Choker | 18ct Gold Plated Perfect for elevating both casual and formal looks, it's the definition of effortless elegance. Orelia London Cross Link Chain Necklace Make a statement with this chunky gold-plated necklace from Orelia. The bold, oversized links add an edgy twist to any outfit, instantly elevating your look. CULT GAIA Reyes Brushed Gold-Tone Necklace Sculptural and bold, this brushed gold-tone necklace from Cult Gaia brings an artful touch to your accessory collection. Ideal for pairing with minimal outfits to let the piece shine. 2. Sculptural EarringsStyle Notes: Sculptural earrings are taking over the jewellery world this year, with designers like Jil Sander and Loewe showcasing artistic, oversized shapes. From abstract twists to geometric forms, these pieces offer a more avant-garde addition to your jewellery collection. The best part? Sculptural earrings immediately make an outfit look more considered and expensive.Look for gold or silver pieces with a matte finish, as this tends to give off a more elevated look. These abstract pieces work particularly well with sleek hairstyles—think low buns or slick ponytails—to let the jewellery take centre stage. Keep the rest of your accessories minimal to allow your earrings to shine.Shop the Trend: Missoma Hera Dome Double Ridge Medium Hoop Earrings | Mixed Metal Mixed metals make these sculptural hoops versatile enough for every occasion. The perfect mix of modern design and classic sensibilities. Orelia London Domed Woven Cut Out Hoop Earrings These dome earrings take the classic silhouette to new heights with their exaggerated, woven design. Minimal yet impactful, they're perfect for both everyday and occasion wear. THOMAS SABO Silver Earrings in Organic Drop-Shape Every fashion editor I know has a pair of earrings with this silhouette, and who can blame them? They're so chic. Monica Vinader Gold Vermeil the Wave Large Stud Earrings If you want a lesson in how to look rich, look to these gold vermeil sculptural studs. Their organic, flowing shape brings a unique touch, making them an ideal statement piece for day-to-night wear. 3. Pearl PowerStyle Notes: Pearls have always been synonymous with elegance, but this year's interpretations are anything but traditional. Designers like Simone Rocha and Alexander McQueen have reinvented pearls by incorporating them into unexpected designs—think multi-strand necklaces, mismatched earrings, and pearls combined with metal elements. This trend strikes the perfect balance between timeless and contemporary.The beauty of this trend is its versatility. Try a layered pearl necklace over a ribbed knit sweater for a fresh take on daytime luxury, or go for pearl-embellished drop earrings to make a cocktail dress feel kitschy and fun. When looking for affordable options, freshwater pearls offer a chic alternative to their pricier counterparts.Shop the Trend: Daisy London Shell Baroque Pearl Drop Earrings 18ct Gold Plate These 18ct gold-plated earrings feature stunning baroque pearls, bringing a modern twist to classic pearl jewellery. Ideal for adding understated glamour to any outfit. MARTHA CALVO Lottie Gold-Tone Pearl Bracelet This pearl-adorned bracelet mixes luxe gold-tone hardware with classic freshwater pearls for a striking contrast. By Anthropologie Layered Pearl Necklaces, Set of 2 Double the impact with this layered pearl necklace set, offering a modern take on the classic pearl strand. Loveness Lee Jewellery Cyrene Recycled Silver Bracelet The perfect fusion of edgy and elegant, with baroque pearls bringing a modern twist to the classic pearl jewellery trend. 4. Crystal AccentsStyle Notes: Crystals are having a moment, and they're being used in ways that feel modern and fresh. From crystal-embellished chokers at Gucci to glittering drop earrings at Saint Laurent, this trend is all about making a statement. The key here is to avoid anything too dainty or overly embellished—instead, think minimalist pieces with a touch of sparkle.When styled right, crystal jewellery can look just as luxurious as diamonds. Opt for sleek, streamlined pieces that add a subtle glamour, whether it's a simple crystal choker worn with an open-collared shirt, or crystal-studded hoops to elevate a little black dress. Keep the rest of your outfit pared back to let the crystals stand out.Shop the Trend: Missoma Tennis Eternity Stacking Ring | 18ct Gold Vermeil Cubic Zirconia The perfect ring for stacking and upping your ring game. ROXANNE ASSOULIN Gold-Tone Cubic Zirconia Earrings Minimalist yet eye-catching, these gold-tone earrings feature shimmering cubic zirconia stones, delivering just the right amount of sparkle to elevate your day-to-night looks. Astrid & Miyu Orbit Crystal Chain Necklace in Gold Draped with delicate crystals, this gold chain necklace adds a refined sparkle to any outfit. Orelia London Crystal Marquise Fan Labret The delicate leave design is a simple way to make your ear stack sparkle without adding anything too heavy. Style Notes: Gone are the days when you had to choose between gold and silver. This season, it's all about mixing your metals for a look that feels modern and unexpected. Designers like Chloé and Hermès have embraced this trend on the runways, showing us that when done right, combining different metals adds dimension and depth to your outfit.The trick to nailing this trend is balance. Start by layering a couple of gold and silver necklaces, or stack rings in contrasting metals. When choosing your pieces, opt for minimalist designs to keep the look cohesive rather than chaotic. Mixed metals also work particularly well with casual, everyday outfits, making it a perfect trend for both day and night.Shop the Trend: ROXANNE ASSOULIN Level Up Set of Two Gold and Silver-Tone Hoop Earrings These two-tone gold and silver hoop earrings are the epitome of modern elegance. Wear them stacked for a bold look or alone for a sleek, minimalist touch. Monica Vinader Sterling Silver Mixed Metal Beaded Chain Bracelet The combination of sterling silver and gold vermeil makes it perfect for everyday wear. ARMS OF EVE Birdie Two Tone Bracelet by Arms of Eve These would look so chic worn on their own—don't you think? Swarovski Hyperbola Bangle, Round Cut, White, Mixed Metal Finish This striking bangle combines silver and gold tones with a round-cut crystal for a sleek, modern look. Perfect for adding a statement finish to any outfit.
html:
If there's one thing I'm always looking out for when browsing my favourite sites, it's expensive-looking jewellery. Whilst jewellery has always been the ultimate finishing touch that can instantly transform a look, it's definitely playing a more important role in 2024 than ever. Whether it's a pair of sculptural earrings or a statement chain necklace, the right piece can make any outfit feel more elevated, polished, and expensive. However, not everyone can or wants to invest in high-end designer pieces that can cost thousands. While luxury brands like Cartier and Van Cleef & Arpels are renowned for their exquisite craftsmanship and timeless designs, the reality is that many of us are looking for ways to capture that same level of elegance without the hefty price tag. This is where the expensive-looking jewellery trend comes into play.

While we all dream of owning a Cartier Panthère watch or a diamond-encrusted necklace, in recent years, we as shoppers have become increasingly conscious of their purchasing decisions, opting for jewellery that combines timeless style and affordability. The idea is to embrace pieces that deliver high-end aesthetics without compromising on quality or breaking the bank. And thankfully, whilst the allure of luxury jewellery is undeniable, it just so happens that there are countless affordable options on the market that offer the same level of sophistication. Instead of investing in pieces that may only be worn on special occasions, many are now seeking versatile jewellery that can be styled for everyday wear, delivering a luxe feel for a fraction of the cost.

This season, the runways have showcased a myriad of expensive-looking jewellery trends that are both striking and accessible. From the bold chains seen at Bottega Veneta to the crystal-embellished pieces at Gucci, designers have embraced an aesthetic that's both refined and modern. But it's not just the runways influencing this shift—our favourite fashion influencers, like Marianne Smyth and Lois Sterling, are embracing jewellery that looks luxe but remains wallet-friendly. These tastemakers show us how to incorporate runway-worthy pieces into everyday looks, proving that you don't need to spend a fortune to achieve that high-end vibe.

So, what makes an expensive-looking jewellery piece? It's all about thoughtful design, quality materials, and the way a piece catches the eye. Sleek, minimalist designs, polished finishes, and details like sculptural forms or pearls all contribute to a luxurious appearance. A well-crafted gold-plated necklace or a pair of oversized crystal earrings can look just as stunning as something from a designer jewellery brand if styled correctly. In fact, the lines between costume and fine jewellery have blurred, with designer fashion houses now offering chic pieces at more accessible prices.

To help you navigate this season's expensive-looking jewellery trends, we've curated five must-try styles that give you the runway feel without the high-end price. From chunky chains to pearls with a twist, these pieces are perfect for anyone looking to elevate their jewellery game while staying budget-conscious.

1. Chunky Chains

Style Notes: It's official: statement chains are back, and bigger than ever. Think oversized links in both gold and silver, as seen on the runways of Bottega Veneta and Valentino. These bold necklaces and bracelets create a focal point to even the simplest outfit, giving you a high-fashion feel without needing anything else.

The perfect blend of being refined but also cool and contemporary, these bolder pieces can make a subtle statement with even the most simple outfit. Pair a gold chain with a classic white tee and jeans for a relaxed daytime look, or layer it over a silk blouse for evening wear. To make the look more affordable, opt for gold-plated pieces that still give you the shine and weight of luxury jewellery.

Shop the Trend:

Astrid & Miyu

Bold Link Chain Bracelet in Gold

This gold-plated link chain bracelet adds instant sophistication to your everyday stack. The chunky links draw attention to your neckline, whether worn solo or layered with your favourite delicate pieces.

Missoma

Zenyu Link Chunky Chain Choker | 18ct Gold Plated

Perfect for elevating both casual and formal looks, it's the definition of effortless elegance.

Orelia London

Cross Link Chain Necklace

Make a statement with this chunky gold-plated necklace from Orelia. The bold, oversized links add an edgy twist to any outfit, instantly elevating your look.

CULT GAIA

Reyes Brushed Gold-Tone Necklace

Sculptural and bold, this brushed gold-tone necklace from Cult Gaia brings an artful touch to your accessory collection. Ideal for pairing with minimal outfits to let the piece shine.

2. Sculptural Earrings

Style Notes: Sculptural earrings are taking over the jewellery world this year, with designers like Jil Sander and Loewe showcasing artistic, oversized shapes. From abstract twists to geometric forms, these pieces offer a more avant-garde addition to your jewellery collection. The best part? Sculptural earrings immediately make an outfit look more considered and expensive.

Look for gold or silver pieces with a matte finish, as this tends to give off a more elevated look. These abstract pieces work particularly well with sleek hairstyles—think low buns or slick ponytails—to let the jewellery take centre stage. Keep the rest of your accessories minimal to allow your earrings to shine.

Shop the Trend:

Missoma

Hera Dome Double Ridge Medium Hoop Earrings | Mixed Metal

Mixed metals make these sculptural hoops versatile enough for every occasion. The perfect mix of modern design and classic sensibilities.

Orelia London

Domed Woven Cut Out Hoop Earrings

These dome earrings take the classic silhouette to new heights with their exaggerated, woven design. Minimal yet impactful, they're perfect for both everyday and occasion wear.

THOMAS SABO

Silver Earrings in Organic Drop-Shape

Every fashion editor I know has a pair of earrings with this silhouette, and who can blame them? They're so chic.

Monica Vinader

Gold Vermeil the Wave Large Stud Earrings

If you want a lesson in how to look rich, look to these gold vermeil sculptural studs. Their organic, flowing shape brings a unique touch, making them an ideal statement piece for day-to-night wear.

3. Pearl Power

Style Notes: Pearls have always been synonymous with elegance, but this year's interpretations are anything but traditional. Designers like Simone Rocha and Alexander McQueen have reinvented pearls by incorporating them into unexpected designs—think multi-strand necklaces, mismatched earrings, and pearls combined with metal elements. This trend strikes the perfect balance between timeless and contemporary.

The beauty of this trend is its versatility. Try a layered pearl necklace over a ribbed knit sweater for a fresh take on daytime luxury, or go for pearl-embellished drop earrings to make a cocktail dress feel kitschy and fun. When looking for affordable options, freshwater pearls offer a chic alternative to their pricier counterparts.

Shop the Trend:

Daisy London

Shell Baroque Pearl Drop Earrings 18ct Gold Plate

These 18ct gold-plated earrings feature stunning baroque pearls, bringing a modern twist to classic pearl jewellery. Ideal for adding understated glamour to any outfit.

MARTHA CALVO

Lottie Gold-Tone Pearl Bracelet

This pearl-adorned bracelet mixes luxe gold-tone hardware with classic freshwater pearls for a striking contrast.

By Anthropologie

Layered Pearl Necklaces, Set of 2

Double the impact with this layered pearl necklace set, offering a modern take on the classic pearl strand.

Loveness Lee Jewellery

Cyrene Recycled Silver Bracelet

The perfect fusion of edgy and elegant, with baroque pearls bringing a modern twist to the classic pearl jewellery trend.

4. Crystal Accents

Style Notes: Crystals are having a moment, and they're being used in ways that feel modern and fresh. From crystal-embellished chokers at Gucci to glittering drop earrings at Saint Laurent, this trend is all about making a statement. The key here is to avoid anything too dainty or overly embellished—instead, think minimalist pieces with a touch of sparkle.

When styled right, crystal jewellery can look just as luxurious as diamonds. Opt for sleek, streamlined pieces that add a subtle glamour, whether it's a simple crystal choker worn with an open-collared shirt, or crystal-studded hoops to elevate a little black dress. Keep the rest of your outfit pared back to let the crystals stand out.

Shop the Trend:

Missoma

Tennis Eternity Stacking Ring | 18ct Gold Vermeil Cubic Zirconia

The perfect ring for stacking and upping your ring game.

ROXANNE ASSOULIN

Gold-Tone Cubic Zirconia Earrings

Minimalist yet eye-catching, these gold-tone earrings feature shimmering cubic zirconia stones, delivering just the right amount of sparkle to elevate your day-to-night looks.

Astrid & Miyu

Orbit Crystal Chain Necklace in Gold

Draped with delicate crystals, this gold chain necklace adds a refined sparkle to any outfit.

Orelia London

Crystal Marquise Fan Labret

The delicate leave design is a simple way to make your ear stack sparkle without adding anything too heavy.

Style Notes: Gone are the days when you had to choose between gold and silver. This season, it's all about mixing your metals for a look that feels modern and unexpected. Designers like Chloé and Hermès have embraced this trend on the runways, showing us that when done right, combining different metals adds dimension and depth to your outfit.

The trick to nailing this trend is balance. Start by layering a couple of gold and silver necklaces, or stack rings in contrasting metals. When choosing your pieces, opt for minimalist designs to keep the look cohesive rather than chaotic. Mixed metals also work particularly well with casual, everyday outfits, making it a perfect trend for both day and night.

Shop the Trend:

ROXANNE ASSOULIN

Level Up Set of Two Gold and Silver-Tone Hoop Earrings

These two-tone gold and silver hoop earrings are the epitome of modern elegance. Wear them stacked for a bold look or alone for a sleek, minimalist touch.

Monica Vinader

Sterling Silver Mixed Metal Beaded Chain Bracelet

The combination of sterling silver and gold vermeil makes it perfect for everyday wear.

ARMS OF EVE

Birdie Two Tone Bracelet by Arms of Eve

These would look so chic worn on their own—don't you think?

Swarovski

Hyperbola Bangle, Round Cut, White, Mixed Metal Finish

This striking bangle combines silver and gold tones with a round-cut crystal for a sleek, modern look. Perfect for adding a statement finish to any outfit.
